content.description: Start sitting down on the left side. Keep left hand on left side and work right hand up. Coming over the top is the crux.
content.protection: Pads and spotter due to sitting on a hillside.
content.location: One the first stand alone boulders right as you enter the woods, just between the cliff line and the mountain bike trail.

content.description: Start with hands going low left around the face of the dihedral. Work the jugs up until you step onto the ledge above.
content.location: Behind and to the left of zacs graduation. In between two dihedrals

content.description: Start on the underling and side pull with your feet soamewhere towards the bottom. Climb up the arette and top out. It's a very fun, easy climb. The bottom is kind of a hill.
content.protection: Pads and spotter but the landing zone is a kjnd of steep hill.
content.location: This is to the left of El Jefe and little boy across the gulch.

climbs.name: Once Knew A Girl From Oglesby

content.description: Sit start on right side of the boulder. Move out to the nose of the prow and then climb over the top.
content.protection: Pads, but I made a solid landing zone. Clear the top of dirt and mud after rain
content.location: Past the little wooden bridge on the mountain bike trail, then look up the hill to your left toward the cliffs.

climbs.name: Once Knew A Boy From Oglesby

content.description: Sit start on back left side of the left face of the prow. Work right toward the tree and then go to the top of the boulder.
content.location: Left of "Once Knew A Girl From Oglesby"

content.description: This wall is the same as the Valpo Problem, just to the right of it.  The rock looks like it has a face in it.  The problem starts to the right of the wall, with a pinch and a ledge.  You have a few options from there, 2 follow out towards Valpo and finish where Valpo does/top out, and the third goes straight up and tops out.I would recommend getting on top of the problem and cleaning off the top out, it's a tad of a mess and I didn't have the stuff to clean it up well
content.location: Directly to the right of Valpo.

content.description: Same dihedral as Valpo, but on the left corner instead of the right.
content.location: On the cliff face, up and left above zachs graduation.

content.description:
Start on the side pull/rail around chest level. Finish by matching on the underside of the roof (there are no holds, press into it).  

  Move up using crimps and jugs/rails. Crux is the first sequence of moves on the route. After the initial sequence of crimps it is nothing but jugs/rails.
content.location:
On the cliff face behind Zach's Graduation and to the right. Has a small triangular roof over the dihedral. 

  Walk down the trail along the cliff face and stay to the left. There should be a small clearing after the second or third trail to the right. Route is off the trail on the cliff face from this clearing on the trail. 

  Nearly all choss has been cleared from the route, the bottom is cleaner than the top. Top of the route will be thoroughly cleaned before the end of May (2017) once I bring my ropes along.

content.description: Starting with left hand on solid jug on left side of the face, right hand on right face, heel hook with left foot and right foot underneath the boulder.  Work around to the left and top out with the more than solid holds.  Could work into an easy traverse as well.
content.location: Small boulder to the left of El Jefe by about 20 feet, well before you get to Mosquito bite.  Straight up the trail after walking over homemade wooden “bridges”

climbs.name: El Jefe
climbs.fa: TR: Korey Tockes, Boulder: Brad Moser

content.description: Bottom 6 feet are chill, getting up on the face over the roof is a little tricky (big roof), crux is on the top face.
content.location: Directly left to I Once Knew A Boy From Ogelsby.

content.description: Dont touch the face to the left of the route
content.location: Right around the corner of Dog Rock

content.description: Start on Dog Rock and traverse on the cliff towards Motormouth and Valpo. Finish on Motor mouth finish.
content.protection: Spotter near finish so you dont go rollin
content.location: Inlet between Dog Rock and Motormouth/Valpo

content.description: start on the Arête with your left hand, right on a crimp, feet in the bottom corner.  Finish sitting on the ledge.
content.location: Just to the Left of Valpo/motor mouth... The Rock looks like a dogs head at the top...

content.description: Sit start, just follow the crack to the top. Easy to avoid the moss. Just a couple moves to reach the top. Fun for an outdoor beginner! There are some loose holds, but they seem locked in there for the most part. Top is basically covered by a growing sapling, which leads to a less-than-attractive topout. Hence the name...
content.location: Directly left, around the corner from Zach’s Graduation.

content.description: Start off like Ear Scratchies, but instead of topping out tragedy to the right, use crack along the ear to fully top out.  I didn't get to work this much, it should send but it was the end of our day and I was beat.  This would need to be brushed before anyone tries.  When we get back out I'll update this to it being cleaned. (also I have no idea what grade this will be so the 0+ is a place holder)

Start on the marked hand holds and traverse across don't use the lip until you reach the section that starts moving up to top out. If you use the lip it probably is substantially easierDid not see this on the page if there's an earlier ascent please enter it. We were a bunch of gym climbers looking for a real V0 if that's you then this is a good route for you hahaha.
content.location: This route is directly to the left of El Jefe

content.description: All of the problems that are east of the waterfall and on the main cliff faces as you enter the woods.
